p: Once the MIC, MBC and MFC parameters were established, the effects of the compounds with the highest antimicrobial activity on a Gram-positive bacterium ( S. aureus 75 MR), a Gram-negative bacterium ( E. coli 128 MR) and a yeast ( C albicans CUSI), for the compounds eugenol ( Figure 1a–c), carvacrol ( Figure 2a–c), and thymol ( Figure 3a–c) were evaluated (the strains were chosen for being multi-resistant and the compounds for presenting the lowest MIC values).
